meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being inclined to steal or commit theft.
meanings.sent1: Her thievishness was evident when she kept taking cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent2: The detective suspected the man's thievishness after finding stolen goods in his possession.
meanings.sent3: The cat's thievishness was revealed when it tried to sneak away with a piece of chicken.
meanings.sent4: His thievishness was like a shadow, always lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The glint in his eyes betrayed his thievishness, giving away his intentions.

meanings.definition: The act of stealing or committing theft.
meanings.sent1: The security camera caught the thievishness on tape.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper was a victim of thievishness when his store was robbed.
meanings.sent3: The thievishness of the raccoon stealing food from the campsite amused the campers.
meanings.sent4: The thievishness of time steals away our youth before we realize it.
meanings.sent5: The thief's thievishness was so blatant, it was almost comical.
